Camera

Contains logic for interacting with the Keyence vision system

Functions
SelectProgram
call Camera.SelectProgram(
programIndex,
&result
);

This function selects a preloaded program on the camera

Parameters
programIndex

The number of the program to load

Response Parameters
&responseCode

The result of the select program function

RunProgram
call Camera.RunProgram(
&responseCode
);

This function runs the previously selected program on the camera

Response Parameters
&responseCode

The result of program execution

SelectAndRunProgram
call Camera.SelectAndRunProgram(
programIndex,
&responseCode
);

This function selects a preloaded program on the camera, then runs it.

Parameters
programIndex

The number of the program to select and run

Response Parameters
&responseCode

The result of the select program function and program execution

See Also

Camera.SelectProgram Camera.RunProgram

GetProgramData
call Camera.GetProgramData(
index,
&result
);

This function returns the result at the requested index of the last program run.

Parameters
index

The index of the desired result

Response Parameters
&result

The returned value at the specified index

GetPixelsPerMillimeterForCamera1
call Camera.GetPixelsPerMillimeterForCamera1(
&value
);

This function returns the value of pixels per millimeter for the first camera

Response Parameters
value

The value of pixels per millimeter

GetPixelsPerMillimeterForCamera2
call Camera.GetPixelsPerMillimeterForCamera2(
&value
);

This function returns the value of pixels per millimeter for the second camera, if it exists.

Note

Invoking this function on a machine with only one camera will result in a fatal program error.

Response Parameters
&value

The value of pixels per millimeter

GetCameraData1
call Camera.GetCameraData1(
&data
);

Returns the first value from the last program run, if the program returned a value

Response Parameters
&data

The value returned

GetCameraData2
call Camera.GetCameraData2(
&data
);

Returns the second value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 2 values

Response Parameters
&data

The value returned

GetCameraData3
call Camera.GetCameraData3(
&data
);

Returns the third value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 3 values

Response Parameters
&data

The value returned

call Camera.GetCameraData4(
&data
);

Returns the fourth value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 4 values

Resposne Parameters
&data

The value returned

&data

Returns the fifth value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 5 values

&data

Returns the seventh value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 7 values

Resposne Parameters

The value returned

call Camera.GetCameraData8(
&data
);

Returns the eigth value return from the last program run, if the program returns at least 8 values

The value returned

call Camera.GetCameraData10(
&data

The value returned

OpenShutter
call Camera.OpenShutter();

Open the camera shutter, if present

CloseShutter
call Camera.CloseShutter();

Close the camera shutter, if present

IsShutterOpen
call Camera.IsShutterOpen(
&isOpen
);

Returns the open/close state of the camera shutter, if present

Response Parameters
&isOpen

TRUE (1) if the shutter is open, or FALSE (0)

StartImageLog
call Camera.StartImageLog(
&responseCode
);

Command the HMI to begin recording images from camera programs

Response Parameters
&responseCode

the result of the command

StopImageLog
call Camera.StopImageLog(
&responseCode
);

Command the HMI to end recording images from camera programs

Response Parameters
&responseCode

the result of the command

SetImageLog
call Camera.SetImageLog(
dir,
&responseCode
);

Command the HMI to store logged images in the given directory

Parameters
dir

the location where images should be stored.  String.

Response Parameters
&responseCode

the result of the command

SendTrigger
call Camera.SendTrigger(
&responseCode
);

Send a manual trigger to the selected camera program

Response Parameters
&responseCode

the result of the command
